means: 使变形，使残废，丑化( deform的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was born with a deformed right leg.
The disease had deformed his spine.
She was born with deformed hands.

entry.tran: （使）变形;（使）成畸形;损毁…的外形
entry.def: If something deforms a person's body or something else, it causes it to have an unnatural shape. In technical English, you can also say that the second thing deforms.

example.tran: 严重的类风湿性关节炎会造成四肢变形。

example.ex: ...the ability of a metal to deform to a new shape without cracking.
example.tran: 金属重新塑形而不断裂的能力

means.word_mean: 1. so badly formed or out of shape as to be ugly;

sentences.sentence: "a limp caused by a malformed foot"

auth_sentence.content: People got cancer and gave birth to deformed babies.
auth_sentence.res_content: People got cancer and gave birth to deformed babies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People got cancer and gave birth to deformed babies.

auth_sentence.content: In retrospect, her interest in deformed feet seems uncanny.
auth_sentence.res_content: In retrospect, her interest in deformed feet seems uncanny.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In retrospect, her interest in deformed feet seems uncanny.

auth_sentence.content: Do you see His work in the birth of deformed babies?
auth_sentence.res_content: Do you see His work in the birth of deformed babies?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Do you see His work in the birth of deformed babies?

sentences.en: A deformed body may have a beautiful soul.
sentences.cn: 身体虽残缺,心灵可美好。

sentences.en: He is cursed with deformed arches.
She had a badly deformed hand.
